result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew L. Riley was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES a sentence of 36 months in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 20 months of Initial Confinement and 16 months of Extended Supervision, to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being.

The Court STAYS this sentence and Places Mr.Riley on Probation for a period of 30 months.

--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  

--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant during the revocation period. Install Ignition Interlock Device in accordance with St. 343.301(2m). Deadline for ignition interlock installation, regardless of license status, is  7/29, 2016, or when the defendant applies or receives a license under Chapter 343, whichever is earlier.  Prisoner is not subject to ignition interlock under St. 308.08(10r).
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment

miscConds.notes: --To pay fine of $1,000 + costs=$2,323(incl. DNA) + $65.74 in blood testing fees to JESO= $2,388.74

--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent

Arresting Agency: JCSD

If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

timeConds.notes:
--To serve 160 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)
Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.

Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

Proposed Order for Ignition Interlock Exemptions - Court denied exemption on record

Cases 15CF303 and 15TR7388 called together at 11:34am [mo]
Defendant Matthew L. Riley in court with Attorney Michael C. Witt.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Mr.Riley waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of " Guilty " entered on Count #1; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses:
--All remaining counts of 15CF303
--Case 15TR7388

The Court discloses, under SCR 60.04 that in the Court's former capacity as Jefferson County District Attorney, attorneys that DA Wambach supervised did prosecute Mr. Riley. The Court does not feel that any disqualification or recusal is needed. 

Sentencing arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES a sentence of 36 months in the Wisconsin State Prison, consisting of 20 months of Initial Confinement and 16 months of Extended Supervision, to be served consecutive to any other sentence in being. Shall this sentence be Imposed, the Court finds Mr. Riley eligible for ERP and SAP

The Court STAYS this sentence and Places Mr.Riley on Probation for a period of 30 months, with conditions:  

 --To serve   160 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with Huber/work release privileges; to commence FORTHWITH, followed immediately by 120  days on SCRAM X ("good time" credit to be applied to both components of order)Release shall be allowed for AA and/or NA meetings.
--Comply with ALL conditions of Jefferson County Alcohol Treatment Court
--absolute sobriety
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--take all prescriptions as prescribed
--no presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid Driver's License and Agent Approval
--any assessment, treatment or counseling as required by the Agent
--To pay fine of $1,000 + costs=$2,323(incl. DNA) + $65.74 in blood testing fees to JESO= $2,388.74 

The Court orders outright: 
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant for a 36 month period  
--6 demerit points assessed
--Ignition Interlock Device required on any vehicle driven by the Defendant during the revocation period. Install Ignition Interlock Device in accordance with St. 343.301(2m). Deadline for ignition interlock installation, regardless of license status, is  7/29, 2016, or when the defendant applies or receives a license under Chapter 343, whichever is earlier.  Prisoner is not subject to ignition interlock under St. 308.08(10r).

The Court does not order attendance at a Victim Impact Panel, since Mr. Riley has already attended. 
On Atty. Witt's request to an IID exception being made for Mr. Riley's collector car; The Court denies the request; gives basis
Days Credit: 1 day

recess: 12:05pm

case called at 1:22pm. [mo]
[Judge Wambach presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Matthew L. Riley appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Whitney Hagemann (For Bond Purposes Only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. Hagemann indicates that an evaluation has not been completed on Mr. Riley and therefore a determination of eligibility has done been made.
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Court confirms date of birth and address on Criminal Complaint
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
The Court finds probable cause to exist within the Criminal Complaint 
Preliminary Hearing time limits are waived by both parties.
Right to Counsel given; Mr. Riley indicates that he wishes to be represented by counsel

The Court requires a $5,000  signature bond, with conditions:
 -  No alcohol possession or ingestion. 
-  No presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores. 
-  No operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license.
-  The Defendant is to report and comply with SCRAM alcohol monitoring program as administered by Wisconsin Community Services.  The Court orders the defendant to SCRAM monitoring through WCS, with the consideration of Remote Breath as an alternative only when WCS verifies that a defendant's work environment or health condition prohibits the SCRAM bracelet.

The Defendant is to comply with all SCRAM Program conditions of participation including payment of program costs and fees.  **If in custody, release on SCRAM only.**

--Booking at Jefferson County Sheriff's Dept. 
--to appear at adjourned initial appearance hearing on 10/6/2015 at 2:00pm in Branch 3, Room 125
recess 1:33 pm. 


NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 10/6/2015 at 2:00pm
